concept.title: Reference_Library
concept.shortdesc: This document contains content such as references that should be the same in all manuals, such as web links, notes and important information that is not related to warnings/safety. For warnings and safety see the Warnings_Library.

div.note: Always dispose of any waste in accordance with local regulations and rules.
A redundant system can have two or more units working together. As example and for illustration purposes a redundant system with two units is shown.
Reboot the NMC to apply changes. From the web interface select Control > Network > Reset/Reboot for options.
For redundant systems: Check that each step is perform on both units before proceeding to next step.
For dual systems: Perform all the steps on one unit, then repeat the complete procedure for the other unit.
If the unit is programmed for autostart and the input is within the tolerance range the unit will start automatically after 60 seconds.
Make sure that the network settings confirm to your cyber security policy.

li.p: Press the Hash key to enter the User stack.
Use the Arrow keys to navigate to Bypass operation.
Press the Clock/number 1 key to turn on bypass operation.
Check that the green static switch EN LED on the mimic diagram is illuminated.
Press the Back key or wait 30 seconds to exit the User stack.
Press the Hash key to enter the User stack.
Use the Arrow keys to navigate to Bypass operation.
Press the Star/number 0 key to turn off bypass operation and switch to normal operation.
If applicable, check that the green static switch EA LED on the mimic diagram is illuminated.
Press the Back key or wait 30 seconds to exit the User stack.

section.title: FCC Statement
section.note: This equipment has been tested and found to comply with the limits for a Class A digital device, pursuant to Part 15 of the FCC Rules. These limits are designed to provide reasonable protection against harmful interference when the equipment is operated in a commercial environment. This equipment generates, uses, and can radiate radio frequency energy and, if not installed and used in accordance with the instruction manual, may cause harmful interference to radio communications. Operation of this equipment in a residential area is likely to cause harmful interference in which case the user will be required to correct the interference at his own expense.
